channel.title: CVE Feed for Octopus Deploy -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Octopus Deploy -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-2572|2024-08-03T00:39:08.148Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server where access is managed by an external authentication provider, it was possible that the API key/keys of a disabled/deleted user were still valid after the access was revoked.

item.title: CVE-2022-3614|2024-08-03T01:14:02.447Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy users of certain browsers using AD to sign-in to Octopus Server were able to bypass authentication checks and be redirected to the configured redirect url without any validation.

item.title: CVE-2022-2528|2024-08-03T00:39:08.062Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to upload a package to built-in feed with insufficient permissions after re-indexing packages.

item.title: CVE-2022-1670|2024-08-03T00:10:03.783Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: When generating a user invitation code in Octopus Server, the validity of this code can be set for a specific number of users. It was possible to bypass this restriction of validity to create extra user accounts above the initial number of invited users.

item.title: CVE-2022-2346|2024-08-03T00:32:09.594Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for a low privileged guest user to interact with extension endpoints.

item.title: CVE-2022-2783|2024-08-03T00:46:04.456Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it was identified that a session cookie could be used as the CSRF token

item.title: CVE-2022-29890|2024-08-03T06:33:43.062Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server the help sidebar can be customized to include a Cross-Site Scripting payload in the support link.

item.title: CVE-2021-26557|2024-08-03T20:26:25.487Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20tentacle
item.description: When Octopus Tentacle is installed using a custom folder location, folder ACLs are not set correctly and could lead to an unprivileged user using DLL side-loading to gain privileged access.

item.title: CVE-2022-2258|2024-08-03T00:32:09.501Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for a user to view Tagsets without being explicitly assigned permissions to view these items

item.title: CVE-2022-4898|2024-08-03T01:55:45.702Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server the help sidebar can be customized to include a Cross-Site Scripting payload in the support link. This was initially resolved in advisory 2022-07 however it was identified that the fix could be bypassed in certain circumstances. A different approach was taken to prevent the possibility of the support link being susceptible to XSS

item.title: CVE-2022-2781|2024-08-03T00:46:04.515Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it was identified that the same encryption process was used for both encrypting session cookies and variables.

item.title: CVE-2022-1881|2024-08-03T00:17:00.929Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server an Insecure Direct Object Reference vulnerability exists where it is possible for a user to download Project Exports from a Project they do not have permissions to access. This vulnerability only impacts projects within the same Space.

item.title: CVE-2022-2049|2024-08-03T00:24:43.963Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to perform a Regex Denial of Service via the package upload function.

item.title: CVE-2022-2075|2024-08-03T00:24:44.145Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to perform a Regex Denial of Service targeting the build information request validation.

item.title: CVE-2022-2780|2024-08-03T00:46:04.527Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it is possible to use the Git Connectivity test function on the VCS project to initiate an SMB request resulting in the potential for an NTLM relay attack.

item.title: CVE-2022-2721|2024-08-03T00:46:03.679Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it is possible for target discovery to print certain values marked as sensitive to log files in plaint-text in when verbose logging is enabled.

item.title: CVE-2022-23184|2024-08-03T03:36:20.357Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected Octopus Server versions when the server HTTP and HTTPS bindings are configured to localhost, Octopus Server will allow open redirects.

item.title: CVE-2022-4009|2024-08-03T01:27:54.167Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for a user to introduce code via offline package creation

item.title: CVE-2022-30532|2024-08-03T06:48:36.351Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy, there is no logging of changes to artifacts within Octopus Deploy.

item.title: CVE-2022-2720|2024-08-03T00:46:03.684Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it was identified that when a sensitive value is a substring of another value, sensitive value masking will only partially work.

item.title: CVE-2022-2259|2024-08-03T00:32:09.439Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for a user to view Workerpools without being explicitly assigned permissions to view these items

item.title: CVE-2021-26556|2024-08-03T20:26:25.523Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: When Octopus Server is installed using a custom folder location, folder ACLs are not set correctly and could lead to an unprivileged user using DLL side-loading to gain privileged access.

item.title: CVE-2022-2013|2024-08-03T00:24:43.695Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In Octopus Server after version 2022.1.1495 and before 2022.1.2647 if private spaces were enabled via the experimental feature flag all new users would have access to the Script Console within their private space.

item.title: CVE-2022-2760|2024-08-03T00:46:04.424Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to reveal the Space ID of spaces that the user does not have access to view in an error message when a resource is part of another Space.

item.title: CVE-2022-3460|2024-08-03T01:07:06.736Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for certain types of sensitive variables to inadvertently become unmasked when viewed in variable preview.

item.title: CVE-2022-2778|2024-08-03T00:46:04.507Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to bypass rate limiting on login using null bytes.

item.title: CVE-2022-2507|2024-08-03T00:39:07.831Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to render user supplied input into the webpage

item.title: CVE-2022-2074|2024-08-03T00:24:44.217Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to perform a Regex Denial of Service using the Variable Project Template.

item.title: CVE-2022-4870|2024-08-03T01:55:45.795Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to discover network details via error message

item.title: CVE-2022-2416|2024-08-03T00:39:07.800Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible for a low privileged guest user to craft a request that allows enumeration/recon of an environment.

item.title: CVE-2022-2508|2024-08-03T00:39:08.065Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it is possible to reveal the existence of resources in a space that the user does not have access to due to verbose error messaging.

item.title: CVE-2022-1901|2024-08-03T00:17:00.930Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to unmask sensitive variables by using variable preview.

item.title: CVE-2022-2883|2024-08-03T00:52:59.909Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to upload a zipbomb file as a task which results in Denial of Service

item.title: CVE-2022-2828|2024-08-03T00:52:59.569Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it is possible to reveal information about teams via the API due to an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability

item.title: CVE-2022-2782|2024-08-03T00:46:04.368Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server it is possible for a session token to be valid indefinitely due to improper validation of the session token parameters.

item.title: CVE-2022-4008|2024-08-03T01:27:54.202Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20tentacle
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Deploy it is possible to upload a zipbomb file as a task which results in Denial of Service

item.title: CVE-2024-4226|2024-08-01T20:33:52.915Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: It was identified that in certain versions of Octopus Server, that a user created with no permissions could view all users, user roles and permissions. This functionality was removed in versions of Octopus Server after the fixed versions listed.

item.title: CVE-2024-4811|2024-08-01T20:55:09.902Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain conditions, a user with specific role assignments can access restricted project artifacts.

item.title: CVE-2024-4456|2024-08-01T20:40:47.292Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server with certain access levels it was possible to embed a Cross-Site Scripting payload on the audit page.

item.title: CVE-2024-4811|2024-07-26T18:50:14.894Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain conditions, a user with specific role assignments can access restricted project artifacts.

item.title: CVE-2024-6972|2024-07-25T05:16:49.256Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain circumstances it is possible for sensitive variables to be printed in the task log in clear-text.

item.title: CVE-2024-2975|2024-06-19T22:04:50.605Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: A race condition was identified through which privilege escalation was possible in certain configurations.

item.title: CVE-2024-2975|2024-04-09T01:02:46.880Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: A race condition was identified through which privilege escalation was possible in certain configurations.

item.title: CVE-2024-4456|2024-06-04T17:55:09.003Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server with certain access levels it was possible to embed a Cross-Site Scripting payload on the audit page.

item.title: CVE-2024-4226|2024-06-04T17:55:44.760Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: It was identified that in certain versions of Octopus Server, that a user created with no permissions could view all users, user roles and permissions. This functionality was removed in versions of Octopus Server after the fixed versions listed.

item.title: CVE-2023-4509|2024-06-04T17:27:23.930Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: It is possible for an API key to be logged in clear text in the audit log file after an invalid login attempt.

item.title: CVE-2024-4811|2024-07-25T04:46:43.523Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain conditions, a user with specific role assignments can access restricted project artifacts.

item.title: CVE-2024-6972|2024-07-25T14:56:32.509Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain circumstances it is possible for sensitive variables to be printed in the task log in clear-text.

item.title: CVE-2024-2975|2024-08-01T19:32:42.513Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: A race condition was identified through which privilege escalation was possible in certain configurations.

item.title: CVE-2024-6972|2024-08-01T21:45:38.363Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: In affected versions of Octopus Server under certain circumstances it is possible for sensitive variables to be printed in the task log in clear-text.

item.title: CVE-2023-4509|2024-08-02T07:31:05.976Z -- octopus%20deploy -- octopus%20server
item.description: It is possible for an API key to be logged in clear text in the audit log file after an invalid login attempt.
